thread.title: Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown
thread.title_full: Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown

author: GARY B. GRAVES
title: Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown
text:
Timothy D. Easley Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown 
Former boxing heavyweight champions Larry Holmes, left, and George Foreman embrace as they speak to the media on the red carpet of the Sports Illustrated Legacy Awards Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Louisville, Ky. Sports Illustrated announced that it will dedicate the franchise's Sportsman Legacy Award in the name of boxing legend Muhammad Ali. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley) Timothy D. Easley Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown 
Former boxing heavyweight champion Larry Holmes speaks to the media on the red carpet of the Sports Illustrated Legacy Awards Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Louisville, Ky. Sports Illustrated announced that it will dedicate the franchise's Sportsman Legacy Award in the name of boxing legend Muhammad Ali. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley) Timothy D. Easley Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown 
Former boxing heavyweight champion George Foreman speaks to the media on the red carpet of the Sports Illustrated Legacy Awards Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Louisville, Ky. Sports Illustrated announced that it will dedicate the franchise's Sportsman Legacy Award in the name of boxing legend Muhammad Ali. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley) Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 5:41 pm Muhammad Ali honored in his Kentucky hometown Associated Press | 
LOUISVILLE, Ky. (AP) — Muhammad Ali won another round of love and appreciation for his achievements as a fighter in and out of the ring. 
The latest celebration of the three-time world heavyweight champion and self-proclaimed "Greatest Of All Time" featured former champions and Larry Holmes and George Foreman, two notable erstwhile opponents who gladly came to honor Ali on Thursday night in his Kentucky hometown.
